newsitem.title: USA: Kapson to buy 90-unit senior residence.
newsitem.headline: Kapson to buy 90-unit senior residence.

text.p: Kapson Senior Quarters Corp said Tuesady it has signed an agreement to purchase Wellspring House of Albany, a 90-unit senior residence in Albany, N.Y. The company will own and operate the facility effective May 1.
The purchase price was not disclosed.
Wellspring House is the second property Kapson has acquired in the Albany market through its 51 percent-owned joint venture with Court Street Development Cos.
The facility includes 63 studios, 21 one-bedroom apartments and six two-bedroom apartments.

Kapson operates 15 assisted living facilities with a total of 1,623 units in New York, New Jersey, Connecticut and Pennsylvania. The facilities can accommodate about 2,400 residents and, said the company, have operated at a 98 percent occupancy rate for the past five calendar years.
